intro: Ligusticopsis capillacea, commonly known as the slender ligusticopsis, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots, parsley, and dill, and is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in umbels, a typical feature of the Apiaceae family. Ligusticopsis capillacea is often found in moist, calcareous soils and thrives in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
